message_2:
First, we can factor out the common factor of x from both the numerator and the denominator:

(4x^2 - 12x) / (2x^3 - 14x^2 + 20x) = x(4x - 12) / x(2x^2 - 14x + 20)

Now, we can cancel out the common factor of x:

x(4x - 12) / x(2x^2 - 14x + 20) = (4x - 12) / (2x^2 - 14x + 20)

Next, we can factor out the common factor of 2 from the numerator and the denominator:

(4x - 12) / (2x^2 - 14x + 20) = 2(2x - 6) / 2(x^2 - 7x + 10)

Now, we can cancel out the common factor of 2:

2(2x - 6) / 2(x^2 - 7x + 10) = (2x - 6) / (x^2 - 7x + 10)

Finally, we can factor the denominator:

(x^2 - 7x + 10) = (x - 2)(x - 5)

So the simplified rational expression is:

(2x - 6) / ((x - 2)(x - 5))
